org.tmotte.tmplz.load.builtin

Class URLTextLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.tmplz.load.builtin.URLTextLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextLoader

    public class URLTextLoader
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextLoader
    Loads text from a URL. Since caching behavior is important, several things should be understood: This last-modified timestamp returned by URLTextLoader.get() is the value of System.currentTimeMillis() when the last change was detected. It is NOT the value of any timestamp reported by the URL's source. Nonetheless URLTextLoader will negotiate with the URL source using last-modified timestamps as a "validator" to detect changes.

      • URLTextLoader

        public URLTextLoader(java.net.URL url,
                     java.net.Proxy proxy,
                     boolean enableBrokenZipResolution)
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to load from.
        proxy - Used when we a proxy server is needed; will be passed to URL.openConnection(Proxy).
        enableBrokenZipResolution - Enables a "temporary" hack/fix for java's inability (as of version 7) to resolve relative URL's using URL's in zip/jar/war files via URI.resolve(). Required by ClassLoaderTextLoaderFactory.

    • Method Detail

      • getAbsolutePath

        public Path getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Because it uses URL/URI's, this class can ask its URL/URI to resolve a path via URI.resolve(). Notes:
        1. Paths containing a ":" are assumed to be absolute, in which case null is returned.
        2. Paths containing a " " character are converted such that " " is replaced with "%20".
        Specified by:
        getAbsolutePath in interface TextLoader
        Returns:
        A Path object representing the absolute path corresponding to mayBeRelativePath, or null if it does not appear to be relative.
        See Also:
        URI.resolve(String)

      • check

        public java.lang.String check()
        Checks its source for changes. Fulfills TextLoader.check() interface method.
        Specified by:
        check in interface TextLoader
